name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - NDM test results provided to Engineer, min compaction 95%
Frequency - Prior to starting MSE Wall
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Induction completed with all construction crew regarding constructing the MSE Wall
Frequency - Prior to starting MSE Wall

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall undertake 'plateau' trial compaction tests to confirm the methodology of constructing the fill. This should be carried out according to TNZ F/1: 1997. The plateau density tests shall be undertaken on 20m test strips with the compaction plant that will be used on site.
Frequency - Three tests per stockpile per piece of Compaction Plant
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Compacted Layer thicknesses for MSE Wall shall be limited to no greater than 150mm.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall supply copies of test results, certificates, etc. to the Engineer to confirm that materials or works comply with the specified requirements.
5 NDM tests per lift, min 95%
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Final layer to be graded back away from the southwall for drainage
Frequency - At completion of the MSE wall
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Panels set at 1:10 with 5 long and 5 short braces at equal spacing
○ Duramesh panels connected together in the horizontal direction not the vertical
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Geofabric and Geogrid right against the panel face with both right in the corner of the panel
○ Geogrid cut in non-structural direction to get around bracing
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Light compaction (Vibrating plate/roller with a mass per m less than 1300kg and a total mass of less than 1000kg) within 1.2m of the panel face
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Photos/measurements of overlaps, min 300mm
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 2m tail for the first 2.4m, increases to 4m after 2.4m high
○ Tail burried into structural fill, 100mm cover
